portcullis_1@opera.desc[1]: A heavy iron portcullis bars the way south.
portcullis_1@opera.name: portcullis_1
portcullis_1@opera.examine:
You find yourself examining a hard iron portcullis, which you have no chance in
of lifting or breaking through!
portcullis_1@opera.desc[0]: A raised portcullis allows you to go south.

box@opera.name: box
box@opera.desc[0]: A paper mache music box in the shape of a barrel organ sits here.

chandelier_1@opera.desc[1]: You see a chandelier hanging above you.
chandelier_1@opera.name: chandelier_1

portcullis@opera.desc[1]: The heavy iron portcullis bars the way north.
portcullis@opera.name: portcullis
portcullis@opera.examine:
You find yourself examining a hard iron portcullis, which you have absolutely
no chance of lifting or breaking through!

rubble_1@opera.desc[1]: Uh oh, the opera's only exit is blocked by rubble!
rubble_1@opera.name: rubble_1

rope@opera.desc[1]: A tightly streched rope supports the chandelier.
rope@opera.name: rope

music_book@opera.name: music_book
music_book@opera.desc[0]: A book of music lies here.

crossbow@opera.name: crossbow
crossbow@opera.examine: It is apparently out of arrows.
crossbow@opera.desc[0]: A heavy crossbow is lying here.

boat@opera.name: boat
boat@opera.examine: It has the words "Property of the Opera House" stamped on it.
boat@opera.desc[0]: A small rowing boat has been left here.

evening_gloves@opera.name: evening_gloves
evening_gloves@opera.examine:
Long and black, these elbow length gloves will enhance your 
          appearance.
evening_gloves@opera.desc[0]: A pair of elegant looking gloves has been dropped here.

scorpion@opera.name: scorpion
scorpion@opera.desc[0]: A beautifully crafted scorpion sits in the case.

note@opera.name: note
note@opera.examine:
The note reads:
	Dear Mr. Manager:
		I am sorry to have to trouble you at a time when you must
	be so very busy, renewing important engagements, signing fresh ones
	and generally displaying your excellent taste.  I know what you
	have done for Carlotta and for a few others whose admirable
	qualities of talent or genius you have suspected.  Of course when I
	use these words, I do not mean to apply them to La Carlotta, who
	sings like a squirt and who ought never to have been allowed to
	leave the Cafe Jacquine.  And I am not speaking of Christine Daae
	either, though her genius is certain, whereas your jealousy prevents
	her from creating any important part.  All the same I should like
	to take advantage of the fact that you have not yet turned her out
	of doors by hearing her this evening.  I will watch the performance
	from my normal seat in Box 5, which will be kept empty for me.
	Should these commands be ignored, a disaster beyond your
	imagination will occur.
				Your Most Humble and Obedient Servant,
				Opera Ghost

mirror@opera.desc[1]: There is a large mirror against the north wall.
mirror@opera.name: mirror
mirror@opera.examine: You see a reflection of yourself.  You cower in fear.
mirror@opera.desc[0]:
A large mirror on the north wall has been moved to reveal a secret passage
leading north.

stone@opera.name: stone
stone@opera.examine: It turns out to be fairly securely imbedded in the floor.
stone@opera.desc[0]: A stone in the doorway does not appear to be attached the way the others are.

chandelier@opera.desc[1]: You see the chandelier hanging from the ceiling below your feet.
chandelier@opera.name: chandelier

rubble@opera.desc[1]: The entrance to the Opera House has been crushed in an explosion.
rubble@opera.name: rubble
rubble@opera.desc[0]: To the north, the doors of the Opera House stand open.

box_ivory@opera.desc[1]: A white ivory box sits on the mantle.
box_ivory@opera.name: box_ivory
box_ivory@opera.desc[0]: The white ivory box is open.

box_ebony@opera.desc[1]: An black ebony box sits on the mantle.
box_ebony@opera.name: box_ebony
box_ebony@opera.desc[0]: The black ebony box is open.

grasshopper@opera.desc[1]: A cunningly crafted grasshopper is inside the box.
grasshopper@opera.name: grasshopper
grasshopper@opera.examine: It seems to be held down by a pin.
grasshopper@opera.desc[0]: A cunningly crafted grasshopper lies on the ground here.

tux_tuxedo@opera.name: tux_tuxedo
tux_tuxedo@opera.examine: It looks like a penguin suit!

opera33@opera.title: Lost in the Mist
opera33@opera.description:
As you cross the silent, mist-enshrouded waters, you lose sight
of all landmarks and get a feeling of being completely alone.

opera25@opera.title: Above the Ceiling
opera25@opera.description:
Here you are among the rafters and ropes in between the roof and the
ceiling of the opera house.  You can see the seats below your feet through
peepholes in the floor.

opera14@opera.title: Bottom Of the Secret Stairs
opera14@opera.description:
You guess you are at about the level of the third cellar underneath
the opera house.  A flight of narrow stone steps leads upward and a
passage leads off to the east.

opera9@opera.title: In The Aisles
opera9@opera.description:
Here amongst the soft, red velvet seats, you can look around at the
ornate gold scrollwork that lines each tier of boxes, the magnificant
frescoed ceiling, and the enormous, gas lit, crystal chandelier.  To
the north is the stage and to the south is the lobby.

opera22@opera.title: The Third Cellar
opera22@opera.description:
Among the props and scenery you see a spriral staircase going both
up and down.

opera27@opera.title: The Underground Lake
opera27@opera.description:
You see to the north a large underground lake here in the fifth cellar
of the opera house.  It is covered by a thick mist that seems to be
mysteriously lit from within.  A passage leads west.

opera16@opera.title: The Third Cellar
opera16@opera.description:
You are surrounded by old scenery and props from past operas.
Passages lead off in all directions.

opera35@opera.title: The Phantom's Lair
opera35@opera.description:
The large room hung completely in black with an enormous stave of
music containing the notes of the Dies Irae many times repeated.  Off
to one side of the room there is a canopy, from which hangs curtains
of red brocaded material, and, under the canopy, an open coffin.  An
enormous organ covers one entire wall.  Against the far wall is a dais,
upon which sits a black throne.

opera29@opera.title: Lost in the Mist
opera29@opera.description:
Here the mist swirls around you, then thins slightly, allowing you
to look into the glass-like surface of the inky waters.

opera36@opera.title: The Torture Chamber
opera36@opera.description:
You have fallen into a hexoganal room made of mirrors.  In one
corner stands an iron tree with one branch, from which hangs a noose.
In the bright light, the tree is reflected into a huge forest.  As the
room is slowly heated up, you begin to hallucinate that you are in an
African forest.  The room continues to get hotter until you either are
roasted alive, or, unable to take the torture any longer, hang yourself
on the iron tree.

opera30@opera.title: Lost in the Mist
opera30@opera.description:
As you cross the silent, mist-enshrouded waters, you lose sight
of all landmarks and get a feeling of being completely alone.

opera24@opera.title: Top of the Spiral Stairs
opera24@opera.description:
At the top of the staircase you feel like you are much more then
one storey up from the bottom.  To your east there is a passage.

opera8@opera.title: The Grand Staircase
opera8@opera.description:
You stand in the magnificant lobby of the opera house.  All around
you are marble sculptures and ornate columns.  To the north lies the
enormous marble Grand Staircase leading further into the theatre.  To
the south lie the front doors of the opera house.

opera17@opera.title: The Third Cellar
opera17@opera.description:
You are surrounded by old scenery and props from past operas.
Passages lead off in all directions.

opera19@opera.title: The Third Cellar
opera19@opera.description:
You are surrounded by old scenery and props from past operas.
Passages lead off in all directions.

opera20@opera.title: The Furnaces
opera20@opera.description:
From here you can see black sillouttes shoveling coal into the
firey furnaces.  Passages lead off in all directions.

opera34@opera.title: The Far Shore
opera34@opera.description:
A stone dock juts out into the dark waters.  There is a passage
leading north.

opera10@opera.title: The Stage
opera10@opera.description:
From here you have an even better view of the ornate interior of the
opera house.  You can also observe singers and dancers rehearsing as well
as carpenters building the scenery for the next performance.  To the west
is a hallway.

opera32@opera.title: Lost in the Mist
opera32@opera.description:
The mist seems to deaden all sound around you until all you can
hear is the lapping of the water against the boat and the beating
of your own heart.

opera13@opera.title: Secret Stairs
opera13@opera.description: A set of narrow stone steps leads downward into darkness.

opera23@opera.title: On the Spiral Stairs
opera23@opera.description: You stand on the spiral stone staircase that extends both up and down.

opera11@opera.title: The Hallway
opera11@opera.description:
This hallway connects the stage to the main dressing rooms.  It is
decorated with colorful posters advertising past operas.  To the east
is the stage, to the west is a door.

opera31@opera.title: Lost in the Mist
opera31@opera.description:
You pass near one of the iron candelabras that jut out of the
dark water to light the mist.

opera21@opera.title: The Third Cellar
opera21@opera.description:
You are surrounded by old scenery and props from past operas.
There is a narrow opening between a farmhouse and a scene from the
"Roi de Lahore."  Passages lead north, east, and west.

opera15@opera.title: The Organ
opera15@opera.description:
You are in the room under the stage from which all the stage
lighting is controlled.  The mass of gas pipes and controls along
one wall gives this room its name.  A dark passage leads east.

opera18@opera.title: The Furnaces
opera18@opera.description:
From here you can see black sillouttes shoveling coal into the
firey furnaces.  Passages lead off in all directions.

opera12@opera.title: A Dressing Room
opera12@opera.description:
You stand in a plainly furnished room in which there is a table
and some chairs, a few makeup cases, and a vase with some flowers in it.

opera28@opera.title: Lost in the Mist
opera28@opera.description:
As you cross the silent, mist-enshrouded waters, you lose sight
of all landmarks and get a feeling of being completely alone.

opera26@opera.title: The Bottom of the Spiral Stairs
opera26@opera.description:
It feels much cooler here for some reason.  You also seem to hear the
sound of water along the passage to the east.

workman@opera.name: workman
workman@opera.description: A workman looks at you and says, "Hey, get outta here."

joseph@opera.name: joseph
joseph@opera.description: Joseph, the scene-shifter, stands here shifting the scene.

carlotta@opera.name: carlotta
carlotta@opera.description: La Carlotta says "Out of my way, churl!"

andre@opera.name: andre
andre@opera.description: Mr. Andre, in his pressed tuxedo, stands here flitting nervously.

ratcatcher@opera.name: ratcatcher
ratcatcher@opera.description: The Ratcatcher says "I am the Ratcatcher, let me pass with my rats."
